sections.text:
Independence falls away behind the wagon like a promise already spent.

Jim Root keeps a hand on the rail as the team leans into the first pull. The canvas smells of pitch and sun. Celeste Barlow stands close, bonnet ribbon tight, eyes steady. Jimmy walks with a stick he pretends is a staff. Sally and Genevieve hop down and climb back up again, unable to keep still.

The road opens. It does not explain itself.

choices.label: Buy supplies while you still can.
Leave at once and trust the road.
Take stock with Celeste before spending.

sections.system: Early impressions travel fast—among strangers, and among your own.

sections.text:
The first miles crowd together. Wagons bunch. A tongue snaps ahead; everyone hears it.

Celeste counts softly. Jimmy watches the horizon as if it might blink. Sally sings until Genevieve joins, then both laugh and stop at once when the sound of coughing drifts through camp.

choices.label: Keep a steady pace close to others.
Push while the ground is easy.
Hang back and let the rush pass.

sections.text:
Camp brings the first quiet. Fire pops. Canvas sighs.

Celeste warms her hands. Jimmy stares at sparks. Sally complains of dust; Genevieve complains of Sally. Jim lets it pass. Everyone is afraid in their own way.

choices.label: Share the fire and trade news.
Set a night watch with Jimmy.

sections.text:
Morning dew beads the canvas. Grit coats everything.

A trader hawks needles, thread, and soap. He wants dollars.

choices.label: Try to barter labor or advice.

sections.text:
The sun turns the prairie hard and bright.

Jimmy’s boots are scuffed thin. Celeste notices and says nothing. A hidden rut lurches the wagon. Small mishaps become long days.

The first trouble is small: a headache, a wrong tiredness.

Sally says her stomach feels mean. Genevieve says she’s hungry. Jimmy goes quiet. Celeste touches Sally’s forehead.

A shallow creek crosses the trail. Clear stones. Quiet current.

Jimmy watches you, learning what answers look like.

choices.label: Scout the bank for the safest angle.

sections.text:
Night wind slips under blankets.

Celeste pulls Genevieve close. Sally mutters. Jimmy pretends not to shiver. Stars look less like guidance and more like distance.
sections.system: The trail doesn’t judge single mistakes. It judges patterns.

sections.text:
A rider offers news—rivers, prices, sickness—and asks what you’ll spare.

His smile is practiced.

choices.label: Trade a little food for information.
Let Celeste speak while you watch.

sections.text:
A trading post of wagons and ledgers. Prices bite. Names don’t matter.

You leave with what you can carry and what you can’t replace.
The plains teach routine. Days stack. Small choices weigh more than speeches.

choices.label: Take a risk to save time.
Repair the wagon where it stands.

choices.label: Take a risk to save time.

sections.text: The trail takes everything. The wagon stands quiet beneath a painted sky. Names are remembered.
